title: Understanding Memory Function Differences Across Lifespan and Mnemonic Training Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic memory theories and their educational applicability
context.additional_context: Learners possess pedagogical research experience in child memory development and competency in designing digital tool-integrated education.

learning_goals: Differences in memory functions across lifespan stages (associative and strategic elements) can be explained in three or more ways
A mnemonic training program for children can be designed to propose strategies for enhancing strategic memory elements
A digital tool-based memory assessment project (portfolio) can be completed in a blended learning environment
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
